content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Creative problem, LGTM!

I approve of this, but we should consider the viability of the puzzle for reverse mode as well before making it public.
Edit: Also, what's the reason for the constraint on the input length? A decent algorithm should be able to handle the max input length of 10,000 characters.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's way better, than a lot of CoC puzzles, that based on some tricky functions or syntax to be solved in a minute and a couple of dozens symbols by those who know this tricks.
I would love to learn how to solve this with LINQ. I also wonder if regex can do it too?

I'm not convinced this would work well in Reverse, especially not with these test cases. For that, at the very least, I would add some shorter test cases at the beginning, but even then I'm not so sure if it would be less obscure.

However, I agree that the constraint is too small, in a straightforward solution, you iterate through the input once and calculate the new position in each step, which is essentially a simple O(n) algorithm.

Ah, I hadn't realized that CG supported such large inputs. I increased the length to 4096. I don't find any value going much further though, because I would need several orders of magnitude more characters to get timeouts.

I had considered including Reverse before, but I felt that many people might trip up on my choice of letters. On the flip side of things, if I added an extra 3 or 4 simple test cases, it feels too much like handholding, which defeats the mystery behind Reverse for me.
